underlying_data: General ledger, accounts payable/receivable, invoices, bank transactions, tax records
core_function: Record transactions, generate financial statements, ensure compliance, manage cash flow
interface_replaceability: Medium - bookkeeping and data entry highly automatable; audit/compliance requires human judgment
realistic_barriers: Tax code complexity, audit requirements, bank integrations, trust (handling money), regulatory oversight (CPA requirements)

underlying_data: Customer contact info, interaction history, deal pipeline, communication logs, account hierarchies
core_function: Track customer relationships, manage sales pipeline, forecast revenue, coordinate team selling
interface_replaceability: Medium - data is portable but workflows span many users and integrations; AI could replace individual rep tasks but not the system of record
realistic_barriers: Deep integrations (email, calendar, phone, marketing), multi-user coordination, audit trails for compliance, ecosystem of 3rd party apps, training/adoption investment

underlying_data: Raw data, queries, dashboards, metrics, logs, application traces
core_function: Store/query data at scale, monitor applications, visualize metrics, enable data science
interface_replaceability: Low-Medium - data infrastructure is foundation; AI needs this data to function; analytics layer more vulnerable than storage
realistic_barriers: Data gravity (moving large data is hard), performance requirements, security/compliance, vendor lock-in from proprietary formats

underlying_data: Design files, templates, brand assets, collaboration history, design systems
core_function: Create visual content, enable design collaboration, maintain brand consistency
interface_replaceability: High - AI image/design generation advancing rapidly; production design workflows still need human creativity
realistic_barriers: Creative workflow complexity, team collaboration features, brand asset management, but generative AI is direct threat

underlying_data: Source code, build artifacts, deployment pipelines, test results, infrastructure configs
core_function: Automate software build/test/deploy, manage code versions, enable collaboration
interface_replaceability: Medium - AI coding assistants augment but developers still need CI/CD infrastructure; ops automation increasing
realistic_barriers: Developer tool preferences, pipeline complexity, security/compliance requirements, integration with cloud providers

underlying_data: Product catalogs, orders, inventory, customer data, storefront configurations
core_function: Enable online selling, manage orders/inventory, process payments, customize storefronts
interface_replaceability: Medium-High - SHOP trades at ~40x non-GAAP. AI disruption risk: if interface shifts from eyeballs to agents, merchants just need API hooks - why build websites? OpenAI has Agent Commerce Protocol (ACP) for agent purchases. Counter: SHOP integrating AI throughout product (Sidekick/Magic) to supercharge merchants; dirty ops/logistics provide moat
realistic_barriers: Payment processing relationships, fulfillment integrations, app ecosystem, merchant switching costs. Any e-commerce company that doesn't do dirty operations and logistics is at risk. Track ACP adoption as bearish indicator

underlying_data: Proprietary datasets, market data, research, ratings, legal/regulatory databases
core_function: Provide authoritative data, enable analysis, support compliance, reduce information asymmetry
interface_replaceability: Bifurcated: TRI/FDS HIGH RISK - market data is commoditized, essentially UI layers that AI disintermediates. Claude Code can find alternatives to FDS data. SPGI LOW RISK - Ratings business is duopoly, legally required, mission-critical; only ~5% of rev from CapIQ. SPGI has proprietary data moat + AI drives margin expansion (MI segment has ~5k+ employees doing manual data collection that can be automated 30%+)
realistic_barriers: TRI/FDS: low barriers, data available elsewhere, AI native entrants emerging. SPGI: regulatory designation (ratings), authoritative/trusted sources, compliance requirements. Verisk has insurance data pooled into nonprofit - impenetrable moat

underlying_data: Tasks, timelines, dependencies, team assignments, project status, comments/discussions
core_function: Coordinate work across teams, track progress, manage resources, enable collaboration
interface_replaceability: Medium-High - task management UI is low moat; MNDY cited SEO algorithm changes hurting top-of-funnel. Seat growth and per-seat pricing stalling as AI agents commoditize UI layer. NOW trades ~14x rev / 100x GAAP EPS; TEAM ~40x fwd EPS - structural rerating to 12-15x GAAP EPS likely
realistic_barriers: Network effects (team already using it), integration ecosystem, template/workflow libraries, but low data lock-in. High SBC will look unmanageable as multiples compress

underlying_data: Property listings, transaction data, valuations, tenant/landlord data, market analytics
core_function: List properties, enable transactions, manage properties, provide market data
interface_replaceability: Medium - search and matching are AI-ready; but transactions require human agents (regulations), property management is operational. CSGP viewed as Bloomberg for real estate - way too expensive given AI risk
realistic_barriers: Real estate regulations, MLS access requirements, transaction complexity, local market expertise needs

underlying_data: Contracts, signatures, document workflows, audit trails, templates
core_function: Enable legally binding e-signatures, manage document workflows, maintain compliance
interface_replaceability: Medium - signature capture is commodity; value is in legal validity, integrations, and workflow automation
realistic_barriers: Legal/regulatory acceptance, security certifications, integration with CRM/CLM, audit trail requirements, trust

underlying_data: Financial transactions, inventory, supply chain data, manufacturing data, cross-functional business processes
core_function: Integrate core business processes, maintain single source of truth for financials, manage supply chain
interface_replaceability: Low - ERP is the operational backbone; AI augments but doesn't replace the transactional core
realistic_barriers: Mission-critical (downtime = revenue loss), regulatory requirements (SOX, GAAP), multi-year implementations, organizational process alignment

underlying_data: Employee records, payroll data, benefits enrollment, time/attendance, performance reviews, compliance docs
core_function: Manage employee lifecycle, run payroll, administer benefits, ensure labor compliance
interface_replaceability: Low - heavily regulated, requires system of record for legal/tax purposes; AI helps at edges (recruiting, Q&A)
realistic_barriers: Payroll tax compliance (state-by-state), benefits administration complexity, audit requirements, data sensitivity, integration with banking/tax systems

underlying_data: Patient records, clinical data, billing codes, regulatory documentation, drug data
core_function: Manage patient care, ensure compliance (HIPAA), handle billing, support clinical decisions
interface_replaceability: Low - heavily regulated (HIPAA, FDA), patient safety critical, audit requirements; AI augments but doesn't replace
realistic_barriers: HIPAA compliance, FDA regulations (for clinical), EHR integration complexity, patient safety concerns, liability

underlying_data: Application logic, data models, workflows, user interfaces, integrations
core_function: Enable non-developers to build applications, automate workflows, create internal tools
interface_replaceability: High - AI can generate code and UIs; low-code value prop (democratize development) overlaps with AI coding assistants
realistic_barriers: Existing app portfolio, governance/security requirements, integration complexity, but threat from AI coding tools is real

underlying_data: Transaction data, merchant data, fraud signals, banking connections, payment credentials
core_function: Process payments, prevent fraud, enable commerce, manage money movement
interface_replaceability: Low - payments are infrastructure; heavily regulated; trust and reliability paramount
realistic_barriers: Regulatory requirements (money transmission licenses), network effects (merchant/consumer adoption), fraud liability, banking relationships

underlying_data: Security logs, threat intelligence, endpoint data, network traffic, vulnerability data
core_function: Detect and respond to threats, protect endpoints/networks, ensure compliance
interface_replaceability: Low - security is mission-critical and rapidly evolving; AI augments SOC but humans needed for judgment calls
realistic_barriers: Regulatory requirements, risk of breach (existential for companies), need for 24/7 response, trust/reputation of vendor

underlying_data: Meeting recordings, transcripts, calendar integrations, virtual background preferences
core_function: Enable remote meetings, record/transcribe calls, integrate with calendar/productivity tools
interface_replaceability: High - video infrastructure is commodity; AI features (summaries, action items) are table stakes. ZM used as case study for SBC-versus-P/E compression
realistic_barriers: Network effects (external meeting participants), integration with calendar/CRM, security/compliance (encryption), but low switching costs
